1.  Show that the moment generating function for a random variable $X\sim Gamma(\alpha,\beta)$ is $\left(1-\beta t\right)^{-\alpha}$.

2.  Let $X$ be a discrete random variable with PMF

$$
    P(X=x)=\left\{\begin{array}{cc}
    0.25+0.5e^{-\theta} & x =0 \\
    0.25+0.5\theta e^{-\theta} & x =1 \\
    0.5\frac{\theta^x}{x!}e^{-\theta} & x = 2,3,\ldots\\
    0 & \textrm{otherwise}
    \end{array}\right.
$$ Show that the PMF is valid.
